humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the largest invasive carcinoma is 3.5 cm in greatest dimension. According to the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the largest focus of invasion of the invasive ductal carcinoma is 3.5 cm in greatest dimension. According to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system, a T stage of T2 is assigned to a tumor that is greater than 20 mm but less than or equal to 50 mm in greatest dimension. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
